comment: And while I was at it, tried using the longest comb my trimmer has

:ctwokinds-eyeroll:*[Oh great, she‚Äôs found her true form.]

‚Äúnow, how are you to say good night to a girl after a date?‚Äù
and the first scenario/example started, dude jus jumps forward on her like a tree frog
Usually these days starts with ‚Äúthe eyes‚Äù.

Sign a relationship was really taking off was when you threw a coat in a puddle for a fine lady to step over.
And ESPECIALLY don't sit on the same toilet!
His & her sinks; Next evolution: His & her toilets
2020 was supposed to be the next 20s
Well we sure have the economic anxiety of the 20s
I got me some dresses and outfits for anthro to wear out and 2020 decided to take after the plague times instead
so now I got nice new clothes and couldn‚Äôt even use them on a date even if I got one cause everything‚Äôs closed and people are to be avoided at all costs
Too many strangers, too many danger.
God damn though. I had the absolutely worst hankering to go to one of my favorite bar and grills.
The other day, it was just the worst realizing I couldn't.
Wanted to go out with grandma for mother's day. Sucked bad.
I really hope they're able to open up again after this is all done and gone eventually.
Best steaks I've ever had in my life.

We have a bbq place up the street with, like, a food truck catering trailer parked in a mostly empty lot near their restaurant. I was thinking they should do a tailgate style thing out there, it‚Äôd be amazing.
Smoky meats, pulled pork, BBQ treats for all!
It's not a super tiny restaraunt chain, but they only have 3 in Arizona, and they're the only one's West of Ohlahoma.
Yeah, NH has little small chain steakhouses like that popping up over the past few years. Excellent detail-oriented owners.
Firebirds Wood Fired Grill. More of an East coast chain.
They‚Äôre the type of place that basically has their own market/butcher shop attached.
Probably the best local real mom n' pops diner in my are is a tiny hole in the wall called "Thai Kitchen". Absolutely love that place as well.
The whole place is maybe only as big as my living room. But their food is absolutely top notch.
The place is the definition of "comfy space"
lol so generic, yeah, there‚Äôs a plave similar to what you describe round here, family owned place with excellent korean call Woo Jung.
Like 40 mins away though, totally worth it
Firebirds is a good 30 minute drive, but the Thai Kitchen is like 3 miles away.
Like it must have invented the term dining ‚Äòparlor‚Äô. lol
I don't go there near often as I should lol.
Good food leaves feels that replenish the soul.
The Thai place was another one my grandma introduced me too. Her tastes are almost always fantastic.
Good brisket is rare to find. If sandwich gotta have swiss and horseradish.
Good brisket is like an art.
I was 45 minutes over yesterday so they had it on for me to take it off with a longer lunch
had no lunch yesterday so I added it to todays
I stayed 30 minutes extra yesterday & 1.20 today
the only time I care to use math in real life
when it‚Äôs attached to my paycheck
